chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: The configuration of the caching plug-in covers many aspects.

section.title: Pipeline configuration
section.para: To make sure the caching is actually used, you have to define assure that the cached pipelines are used in the cases where you want the cache to be enabled.
The easiest configuration is to enable the caches to be used by default. This can be done by including the file classpath:org/geomajas/plugin/caching/DefaultCachedPipelines.xml
Alternatively you can configure for each layer individually which pipelines should be used.
The following cached pipelines exist (bean names):

PIPELINE_SAVE_OR_UPDATE_ONE_CACHED: pipeline for the saveOrUpdate() on a vector layer.
PIPELINE_GET_FEATURES_CACHED: pipeline for getting feature from a vector layer.
PIPELINE_GET_BOUNDS_CACHED: pipeline to determine layer bounds.
PIPELINE_GET_VECTOR_TILE_CACHED: pipeline to get a tile for a vector layer.

section.title: Cache configuration
section.para:
Cache configuration can be configured individually for each layer and cache category (which more or less matches type of object). This is done using the CacheInfo object. As you can see in listing you can define three properties
layerId: the layer for which this configuration applies.
category: the cache category for which this configuration applies. This is always in instance of the CacheCategory class.
cacheFactory: the factory which should be used to create cache instances. This is a bean of type CacheFactory which is responsible for creating cache instances.

The layerId and category properties are not required to be set. This can be used to set default caches to be used. When searching the configuration for a layer/category combination, the following search order is used.
matching layerId and matching category
matching layerId and null category
matching category and null layerId
null layerId and null category
The properties are null when no value is specified. If the application context contains more than one bean matching bean (for each of the lines above) the last definition is used.

section.title: Infinispan caches
section.para: One of the caching service which is provided out of the box uses Infinispan as the caching library.
This provides two ways to provide the actual configuration. Either by passing a configuration file which is searched on the classpath (and if no found there, on the filesystem).
Alternatively, you can pass a configuration object which contains the relevant settings.

example.title: Infinispan cache configuration using configuration object
example.programlisting: <bean class="org.geomajas.plugin.caching.service.CacheInfo"> <property name="cacheFactory"> <bean class="org.geomajas.plugin.caching.cache.InfinispanCacheFactory"> <property name="configuration"> <bean class="org.infinispan.config.Configuration"> <property name="evictionMaxEntries" value="5000" /> <property name="evictionStrategy" value="LRU" /> </bean> </property> </bean> </property> </bean>

section.title: Spatial index configuration
section.para:
The spatial index to be used while caching can be configured individually for each layer and cache category. This is done using CacheIndexInfo objects. As you can see in listing you can define three properties
layerId: the layer for which this configuration applies.
category: the cache category for which this configuration applies. This is always in instance of the CacheCategory class.
cacheIndexFactory: the factory which should be used to create spatial index instances. This is a bean of type CacheIndexFactory which is responsible for creating cache instances.

The layerId and category properties are not required to be set. This can be used to set default caches to be used. When searching the configuration for a layer/category combination, the following search order is used.
matching layerId and matching category
matching layerId and null category
matching category and null layerId
null layerId and null category
The properties are null when no value is specified. If the application context contains more than one bean matching bean (for each of the lines above) the last definition is used.
